TopicTitle: Who can land the Biggest Christmas Tree on Minmus?

Articles.Content:
As the title suggests, I'm looking to see who can get the tallest Christmas Tree on Minmus; Spreading Festive joy throughout the cold and frozen moon!

The challenge is simple, you build a Christmas tree (yes, you can build it in orbit), measure the amount of small I-beams that it's equivalent to and land it on Minmus!

RULES

--------------------

Any cheats like Hyper-edit are banned.

All infinite fuel cheats are banned.

You must only measure what is actually going to land on the surface of Minmus.

Mechjeb is allowed.

Aviation (Christmas) Lights are allowed.

--------------------

SCORING

--------------------

A point for every small I-beam tall your tree is, please be sensible and don't just

make a ginormous pole with bits sticking out of it and call that a tree.

--------------------

As you'd expect, I've made a stab at the challenge which you can watch here. It's basically a starter just to set what you need to beat. Speaking of Videos, in order to make a valid entry: supplying a set of pictures or a video is needed.

HatBat. Good Luck, I'll see you on Minmus!

PARTICIPANTS (so far)

----------------------

HatBat - 4.66

----------------------

[MY ENTRY]

(My entry is worth 4.66 points)
Those tiny cube struts are massless parts, so a tiny rocket will do, and this is basically limited by how much parts your PC can display without catching fire, lol..
It would be better to use parts whit an actual mass

You can use whatever parts you please, providing it looks like a Christmas tree of course. But in terms of the massless parts: I'm afraid I had to use them as I-beams have an odd glitch where they make the ship do a somersault when you arrange them in a spiked formation; However this is more of a challenge of the ability to apply theory in order to get around the logistics of transporting, and landing, a Christmas tree on Minmus. Not to mention it's really fun
